subject: Coronavirus pandemic
title: Covid vaccines: At-risk children to get jab in Wales
article: Children aged between five and 11 years old with conditions that make them vulnerable to Covid-19 will be offered jabs in Wales from the new year. It follows advice fromUK vaccine advisers . Boosters will also be offered to 16 to 17-year-olds, and vulnerable younger teenagers. A low-dose version of a Covid vaccine for five to 11-year-olds has just been approved for use in the UK after being deemed safe and effective. Health Minister Eluned Morgan confirmed Wales would follow advice from the Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisation (JCVI) on Friday. The JCVI has advised the vaccine should be limited, for now, to those who are clinically vulnerable due to conditions such as severe neuro-disability, heart and lung diseases and cancer.
